heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 13 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (183°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.9°C), outside temperature (down 2.6°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 217 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 351 m) and inside temperature (up 2.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 216.7m lower than yesterday, 11.6m higher than the past week, 350.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1039m minimum and 2260m maximum, with an average of 1249.6m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1238.0m and 1600.2m.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and the light is absent. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
